subject: p11880923
History: -year-old male with alcoholic cirrhosis and worsening renal function, now on HD, check AC line placement.
Findings: There has been interval placement of a right IJ approach tunneled HD catheter, the tip of which projects over the expected location of the right atrium. Lung volumes remain somewhat low, and there is interval increase in bibasilar airspace opacity, right greater than left, concerning for right lower lobe pneumonia. Small-moderate right greater than left pleural effusions are increased. There is no pneumothorax. The cardiac silhouette is top normal for size, and unchanged from prior. Mediastinal contours remain normal.
Impression: Interval hemodialysis catheter placement, the tip of which projects over the expected location of the right atrium. New development of bilateral lower lobe atelectasis and/or pneumonia, with moderate right and small left pleural effusions.
